citation.article-title: Pseudomonas protegens sp. nov., widespread plant-protecting bacteria producing the biocontrol compounds 2,4-diacetylphloroglucinol and pyoluteorin

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas protegens sp. nov.
id="par0130">Pseudomonas protegens (pro’te.gens. L. part. adj. protegens protecting, referring to the ability of the organism to protect plants from soil-borne phytopathogens).
Cells of type strain CHA0 in culture are rods (0.3–0.5 × 1–4 μm) with one to three flagella [67].
Colonies on King's B agar medium are white-yellowish and become fluorescent under UV light.
The doubling time of strain CHA0 is 50 min at 30 °C in the rich medium nutrient-yeast extract [67].
Growth occurs between 4 °C and 36 °C [67].

All Phl+ Plt+ strains are strict aerobes, oxidase-positive, arginine dihydrolase-positive, gelatinase-positive (with the exception of strain Pf-5), and hydrolyse Tween 80 (polyoxyethylene sorbitan monooleate).
Nitrate is not reduced.
Strains do not produce levan, are not pectinolytic and do not hydrolyse DNA and aesculin.
A few strains can cause hypersensitivity on tobacco leaves.
Acid is produced from mannitol but not from sorbitol and erythritol.
Alcalinisation is produced from DL lactate but not from L(+) and D(−) tartrate.

On biotype 100 strips, P. protegens strains assimilate the following 45 substrates: alpha-D(+) glucose, beta-D(+) fructose, D(+) trehalose, D(+) mannose, glycerol, myo-inositol, D-mannitol, L(−) malate, cis-aconitate, trans-aconitate, citrate, 2-keto-D-gluconate, N-acetyl-D-glucosamine, D-gluconate, phenylacetate, protocatechuate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, (−) quinate, benzoate, betain, putrescine, DL-alpha-amino-n-butyrate, histamine, DL-lactate, caprate, caprylate, succinate, fumarate, glutarate, DL-glycerate, DL-alpha-amino-n-valerate, ethanolamine, D-glucosamine, itaconate, DL-beta-hydroxybutyrate, L-aspartate, L-glutamate, L-proline, D-alanine, L-alanine, L-serine, malonate, propionate, L-tyrosine, 2-ketoglutarate, and 2-oxoglutarate.

In contrast, the following 49 biotype-100 substrates are not assimilated: D(+) galactose, L(+) sorbose, alpha-D(+) melibiose, D(+) raffinose, maltotriose, maltose, alpha-lactose, lactulose, 1-0-methyl-beta-galactopyranoside, 1-0-methyl-alpha-galactopyranoside, D(+) cellobiose, beta-gentiobiose, 1-0-methyl-beta-D-glucopyranoside, aesculin, L(+) arabinose, D(+) xylose, palatinose, alpha-L-rhamnose, alpha-L(-) fucose, D(+) melezitose, L(−) arabitol, xylitol, dulcitol, D-tagatose, maltitol, D(+) turanose, D-sorbitol, adonitol, hydroxyquinoline-beta-glucuronide, D-lyxose, i-erythritol, 1-0-methyl-alpha-D-glucopyranoside, 3-0-methyl-D-glucopyranose, D-saccharate, mucate, L(+) tartrate, D(−) tartrate, meso-tartrate, tricarballylate, D-galacturonate, 5-keto-D-gluconate, L-tryptophan, gentisate, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 3-phenylpropionate, m-coumarate, trigonelline, L-histidine, tryptamine.
All P. protegens strains are ACC deaminase-negative [69].
Reduction of manganese is variable [57].
id="par0135">In addition to Phl and Plt, P. protegens strains also produce the biocontrol metabolites HCN and pyrrolnitrin [56; our unpublished results].
Strains of P. protegens are typically soil inhabitants and are mostly isolated from plant roots.
Strains of the species are characterized by their unique pyoverdine siderotype.
id="par0140">The type strain CHA0 was isolated from tobacco roots in Switzerland.
It has been deposited at the CFBP (as CFBP 6595) and at the DSM (as DSM 19095).
No plasmid has been found in strain CHA0 [67].
The G + C content of strains CHA0 and Pf-5 is 60.1 and 63.3 mol%, respectively (i.e. well within the range (58–69 mol%) of the genus Pseudomonas [42]).
The type strain presents all the properties given above for the species description.
In addition, it is lecithinase-positive, urease-positive, lysine decarboxylase-negative, ornithine decarboxylase-negative, tryptophan deaminase-negative [67].
